text.p: Eighteen people were killed and 31 injured in a plane crash on Saturday on the Indonesian island of Belitung, officials and news reports said.

The official Antara news agency said a Merpati Nusantara Airlines twin turbo-prop aircraft with 52 passengers and five crew crashed short of the Buluh Tumbang airport on Belitung, 400 km (250 miles) north of Jakarta at about 7:53 a.m. (0053 GMT).
Antara quoted the spokesman of the South Sumatra provincial administration in Palembang as saying 18 had died. However an official at the hospital gave a lower figure.
"Forty-six people were admitted to hospital. Fifteen have died," a doctor at the Belitung general hospital told Reuters by telephone.
"We are still observing them and we do not yet have information on how many are seriously injured or have medium or light injuries," he said, adding that 11 people were not injured.
"It appears there were only people from Jakarta and Belitung, but the data on the victims is not yet complete," he added.
Antara said the dead included the pilot and a stewardess.

Search and rescue officials in Jakarta said the cause of the crash was not yet known. But they said the plane, which was on a flight to Belitung from Jakarta, had broken into three sections upon impact.
Antara quoted the South Sumatra provincial administration as saying Transport Minister Haryanto Dhanutirto had already carried out an initial examination at the site of the accident.
